channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: In-Context Transfer Learning: Demonstration Synthesis by Transferring Similar Tasks
item.description: To address this, inspired by transfer learning, we propose In-Context Transfer Learning (ICTL), which synthesizes target task demonstrations by transferring labeled demonstrations from similar source tasks.

item.title: MOREL: Enhancing Adversarial Robustness through Multi-Objective Representation Learning
item.description: Through extensive experiments, we demonstrate that our approach significantly enhances the robustness of DNNs against white-box and black-box adversarial attacks, outperforming other methods that similarly require no architectural changes or test-time data purification.

item.title: [Re] Network Deconvolution
item.description: In particular, we interrogate the validity of the authors' claim that using network deconvolution instead of batch normalization improves deep learning model performance.

item.title: AgriCLIP: Adapting CLIP for Agriculture and Livestock via Domain-Specialized Cross-Model Alignment
item.description: Further, this domain desires fine-grained feature learning due to the subtle nature of the downstream tasks (e. g, nutrient deficiency detection, livestock breed classification).

item.title: VitaGlyph: Vitalizing Artistic Typography with Flexible Dual-branch Diffusion Models
item.description: Artistic typography is a technique to visualize the meaning of input character in an imaginable and readable manner.

item.title: Elaborative Subtopic Query Reformulation for Broad and Indirect Queries in Travel Destination Recommendation
item.description: Such queries are challenging due to the wide scope and subtlety of potential user intents that confound the ability of retrieval methods to infer relevant destinations from available textual descriptions such as WikiVoyage.

item.title: CrowdCounter: A benchmark type-specific multi-target counterspeech dataset
item.description: We evaluate two frameworks for generating counterspeech responses - vanilla and type-controlled prompts - across four large language models.

item.title: VinePPO: Unlocking RL Potential For LLM Reasoning Through Refined Credit Assignment
item.description: In this work, we systematically evaluate the efficacy of value networks and reveal their significant shortcomings in reasoning-heavy LLM tasks, showing that they barely outperform a random baseline when comparing alternative steps.

item.title: Aggregation of Multi Diffusion Models for Enhancing Learned Representations
item.description: AMDM offers a new perspective for tackling the challenges of fine-grained conditional control generation in diffusion models: We can fully utilize existing conditional diffusion models that control specific aspects, or develop new ones, and then aggregate them using the AMDM algorithm.

item.title: PASS:Test-Time Prompting to Adapt Styles and Semantic Shapes in Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Test-time adaptation (TTA) has emerged as a promising paradigm to handle the domain shifts at test time for medical images from different institutions without using extra training data.

item.title: Fast Summation of Radial Kernels via QMC Slicing
item.description: The fast computation of large kernel sums is a challenging task, which arises as a subproblem in any kernel method.

item.title: Fira: Can We Achieve Full-rank Training of LLMs Under Low-rank Constraint?
item.description: In this way, we can preserve the low-rank constraint in the optimizer while achieving full-rank training for better performance.

item.title: shapiq: Shapley Interactions for Machine Learning
item.description: In this work, we introduce shapiq, an open-source Python package that unifies state-of-the-art algorithms to efficiently compute SVs and any-order SIs in an application-agnostic framework.

item.title: PROXI: Challenging the GNNs for Link Prediction
item.description: Motivated by these observations, we conduct empirical tests to compare the performance of current GNN models with more conventional and direct methods in link prediction tasks.

item.title: A versatile machine learning workflow for high-throughput analysis of supported metal catalyst particles
item.description: Accurate and efficient characterization of nanoparticles (NPs), particularly regarding particle size distribution, is essential for advancing our understanding of their structure-property relationships and facilitating their design for various applications.

item.title: Revisiting Hierarchical Text Classification: Inference and Metrics
item.description: We introduce a new challenging dataset and we evaluate fairly, recent sophisticated models, comparing them with a range of simple but strong baselines, including a new theoretically motivated loss.

item.title: MM-LDM: Multi-Modal Latent Diffusion Model for Sounding Video Generation
item.description: Sounding Video Generation (SVG) is an audio-video joint generation task challenged by high-dimensional signal spaces, distinct data formats, and different patterns of content information.

item.title: Theoretical Lower Bounds for the Oven Scheduling Problem
item.description: We thoroughly examine these lower bounds, evaluating their quality and exploring their integration into existing solution methods.

item.title: SinkSAM: A Monocular Depth-Guided SAM Framework for Automatic Sinkhole Segmentation
item.description: Soil sinkholes significantly influence soil degradation, but their irregular shapes, along with interference from shadow and vegetation, make it challenging to accurately quantify their properties using remotely sensed data.

item.title: DLP-LoRA: Efficient Task-Specific LoRA Fusion with a Dynamic, Lightweight Plugin for Large Language Models
item.description: This approach reduces inference time to less than twice that of single LoRA inference by leveraging parallel computation.

item.title: Locret: Enhancing Eviction in Long-Context LLM Inference with Trained Retaining Heads
item.description: To our knowledge, Locret is the first framework capable of deploying Llama-3. 1-8B or similar models on a single Nvidia 4090 GPU, enabling 128K long-context inference without compromising generation quality, and requiring little additional system optimizations.

item.title: LASeR: Learning to Adaptively Select Reward Models with Multi-Armed Bandits
item.description: Our results on commonsense and math reasoning tasks demonstrate that LASeR can boost iterative LLM optimization by optimizing for multiple RMs, improving the absolute average accuracy of Llama-3-8B over three datasets by 2. 67% over training with ensemble RM scores while also showing superior training efficiency (e. g., a 2x speedup).

item.title: 3DGS-DET: Empower 3D Gaussian Splatting with Boundary Guidance and Box-Focused Sampling for 3D Object Detection
item.description: Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF) are widely used for novel-view synthesis and have been adapted for 3D Object Detection (3DOD), offering a promising approach to 3DOD through view-synthesis representation.

item.title: Text2PDE: Latent Diffusion Models for Accessible Physics Simulation
item.description: We show that language can be a compact, interpretable, and accurate modality for generating physics simulations, paving the way for more usable and accessible PDE solvers.

item.title: CycleBNN: Cyclic Precision Training in Binary Neural Networks
item.description: This paper works on Binary Neural Networks (BNNs), a promising avenue for efficient deep learning, offering significant reductions in computational overhead and memory footprint to full precision networks.

item.title: HarmAug: Effective Data Augmentation for Knowledge Distillation of Safety Guard Models
item.description: Another LLM generates a response to the harmful instruction, and the teacher model labels the instruction-response pair.

item.title: Response Estimation and System Identification of Dynamical Systems via Physics-Informed Neural Networks
item.description: The accurate modelling of structural dynamics is crucial across numerous engineering applications, such as Structural Health Monitoring (SHM), seismic analysis, and vibration control.

item.title: Explainable Earth Surface Forecasting under Extreme Events
item.description: With climate change-related extreme events on the rise, high dimensional Earth observation data presents a unique opportunity for forecasting and understanding impacts on ecosystems.

item.title: Fake It Until You Break It: On the Adversarial Robustness of AI-generated Image Detectors
item.description: While generative AI (GenAI) offers countless possibilities for creative and productive tasks, artificially generated media can be misused for fraud, manipulation, scams, misinformation campaigns, and more.

item.title: Codev-Bench: How Do LLMs Understand Developer-Centric Code Completion?
item.description: Code completion, a key downstream task in code generation, is one of the most frequent and impactful methods for enhancing developer productivity in software development.

item.title: Perceptual Piercing: Human Visual Cue-based Object Detection in Low Visibility Conditions
item.description: The findings offer a viable solution for enhancing object detection in poor visibility and contribute to the broader understanding of integrating human visual principles into deep learning algorithms for intricate visual recognition challenges.

item.title: MiraGe: Editable 2D Images using Gaussian Splatting
item.description: Our approach improves the rendering quality and allows realistic image modifications, including human-inspired perception of photos in the 3D world.

item.title: Toward Zero-Shot Learning for Visual Dehazing of Urological Surgical Robots
item.description: In addition, we organize and propose a dehaze dataset for robotic vision in urological surgery (USRobot-Dehaze dataset).

item.title: From Code to Correctness: Closing the Last Mile of Code Generation with Hierarchical Debugging
item.description: While large language models have made significant strides in code generation, the pass rate of the generated code is bottlenecked on subtle errors, often requiring human intervention to pass tests, especially for complex problems.

item.title: Integrating Visual and Textual Inputs for Searching Large-Scale Map Collections with CLIP
item.description: Despite the prevalence and historical importance of maps in digital collections, current methods of navigating and exploring map collections are largely restricted to catalog records and structured metadata.

item.title: Recovering Manifold Structure Using Ollivier-Ricci Curvature
item.description: We introduce ORC-ManL, a new algorithm to prune spurious edges from nearest neighbor graphs using a criterion based on Ollivier-Ricci curvature and estimated metric distortion.

item.title: Positional Attention: Out-of-Distribution Generalization and Expressivity for Neural Algorithmic Reasoning
item.description: There has been a growing interest in the ability of neural networks to solve algorithmic tasks, such as arithmetic, summary statistics, and sorting.

item.title: Revisiting Optimism and Model Complexity in the Wake of Overparameterized Machine Learning
item.description: Common practice in modern machine learning involves fitting a large number of parameters relative to the number of observations.

item.title: MedQA-CS: Benchmarking Large Language Models Clinical Skills Using an AI-SCE Framework
item.description: Combined with existing benchmarks, MedQA-CS enables a more comprehensive evaluation of LLMs' clinical capabilities for both open- and closed-source LLMs.

item.title: "No Matter What You Do!": Mitigating Backdoor Attacks in Graph Neural Networks
item.description: To achieve this objective, we ask: How to recover universal and hard backdoor triggers in GNNs?

item.title: Uncertainty Quantification with Bayesian Higher Order ReLU KANs
item.description: We introduce the first method of uncertainty quantification in the domain of Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks, specifically focusing on (Higher Order) ReLUKANs to enhance computational efficiency given the computational demands of Bayesian methods.

item.title: KnobGen: Controlling the Sophistication of Artwork in Sketch-Based Diffusion Models
item.description: Recent advances in diffusion models have significantly improved text-to-image (T2I) generation, but they often struggle to balance fine-grained precision with high-level control.

item.title: Closed-loop Long-horizon Robotic Planning via Equilibrium Sequence Modeling
item.description: In the endeavor to make autonomous robots take actions, task planning is a major challenge that requires translating high-level task descriptions into long-horizon action sequences.

item.title: PairDistill: Pairwise Relevance Distillation for Dense Retrieval
item.description: Effective information retrieval (IR) from vast datasets relies on advanced techniques to extract relevant information in response to queries.

item.title: Introducing Flexible Monotone Multiple Choice Item Response Theory Models and Bit Scales
item.description: Bit scales are especially useful for models for which minimal or no assumptions are made for the latent trait scale distributions, such as for the autoencoder fitted models in this study.

item.title: Knowledge-Driven Feature Selection and Engineering for Genotype Data with Large Language Models
item.description: Predicting phenotypes with complex genetic bases based on a small, interpretable set of variant features remains a challenging task.

item.title: OmniGenBench: Automating Large-scale in-silico Benchmarking for Genomic Foundation Models
item.description: Recent breakthroughs in GFMs, such as Evo, have attracted significant investment and attention to genomic modeling, as they address long-standing challenges and transform in-silico genomic studies into automated, reliable, and efficient paradigms.

item.title: Open3DTrack: Towards Open-Vocabulary 3D Multi-Object Tracking
item.description: To address this limitation, we introduce open-vocabulary 3D tracking, which extends the scope of 3D tracking to include objects beyond predefined categories.

item.title: Question-guided Knowledge Graph Re-scoring and Injection for Knowledge Graph Question Answering
item.description: Knowledge graph question answering (KGQA) involves answering natural language questions by leveraging structured information stored in a knowledge graph.

item.title: Integrative Decoding: Improve Factuality via Implicit Self-consistency
item.description: Self-consistency-based approaches, which involve repeatedly sampling multiple outputs and selecting the most consistent one as the final response, prove to be remarkably effective in improving the factual accuracy of large language models.
